titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the Wolfgang Janisch papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-03-24T09:31-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Preliminary inventory added to Archivists' Toolkit and Scope and Content and Biographical notes revised by Sally DeBauche.
Note regarding user agreement removed by Justyna Szulc as one is no longer required.

physdesc.extent: 21 manuscript boxes, 13 oversize boxes, 2 cubic foot boxes, 4 linear feet

did.abstract: Memoirs, photographic collages, other photographs, postcards, correspondence, police reports, printed matter, sound recordings, videocassettes, and memorabilia relating to political dissent and the peace movement in East Germany.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Wolfgang Janisch papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2000.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Wolfgang Janisch is a German photo collage artist and peace activist. Born in Berlin in 1940, Janisch’s early years were defined by the turmoil of life in post-war occupied Berlin. Living in East Berlin, Janisch often found himself ideologically at odds with the Soviet authorities, and his views are evidenced in his large body of work. Janisch specialized in photo collage and created hundreds of posters that satirically expressed his critical view of the Soviet government.

In addition to his work as an artist, Janisch worked for several publishing houses, including Dietz Verlag, Verlag Junge Welt, and Verlag Volk und Welt as a typesetter and designer of book jackets and cover pages. Janisch is also active in several organizations promoting the peace movement in Germany, including the Netzwerk Friedensteuer and the Mobile Friedensseminar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Wolfgang Janisch papers consist primarily of his memoirs, photographic collages, other photographs, postcards, and correspondence related to political dissent and the peace movement in East Germany. A highlight of the Janisch papers is the significant collection of his original photographs, posters, and galleys of collages. The collection also includes documentation of Janisch’s persecution by the East German government through correspondence and police reports. The final theme of the papers is Janisch’s political activism in the peace movement in East Germany.

did.unittitle: Memoirs: Ein Glas voll bunter Scherben
Poems: Final manuscript: Opa’s poetische Erguesse,
Documents: Klaus Janisch: Occupation at theatre,
Letters: Janisch to mother during military service,

Das Haus am Laerchen Wald, two volumes, Jiří Křenek

Konrad’s Traktor. Kahlau, Heinz; Platzer Rudolf. Verlag Junge Welt, Berlin,
Die grosse Initiative, V. I. Lenin. Dietz Verlag, Berlin,

Surface Waves and Discontinuities. Malischewsky, Peter. Akademie-Verlag, Berlin,
10 sowjetdeutsche Erzähler. Verlag Volk und Welt, Berlin,
Litauische Poesie aus zwei Jahrhunderten. Verlag Volk und Welt, Berlin,
Illustrierte Geschichte der deutschen frühbuergerlichen Revolution. Dietz-Verlag, Berlin,
A series of books honoring the best designed books of each year

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Janisch is included in many of these volumes.

Collage: "Hurra! Gorbatschow fällt auf die Nase"

84 posters about environmental concerns, peace, critique of consumer culture, militarism and German past in general,
25 files, matted prints of animals, abstract images, galley prints

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoirs of East German pastor, with copy of Janisch’s letter to him after publication.

did.unittitle: Material revealing the time of the GDR,
Framed painting given to Janisch's parents by a Russian prisoner of war in thanks for their help,
Album of postcard reproductions of posters by Josef Huber,
Sozialdemokratische Partei Deutschlands correspondence and newspaper clippings,
Deutsche Demokratische Republik reparations correspondence and newspaper clippings,
Correspondence related to Janisch's artwork with various publishers, museums, and archives,
